characters: A person on a bicycle or scooter, gender and age not discernible due to night conditions and distance.
summary: In this segment, the self-driving vehicle is traveling at night on a road under an overpass. From the beginning of the video, a person on a bicycle or scooter is visible ahead in the same lane, moving slowly. The vehicle approaches this person from behind without apparent significant deceleration or evasive action. Around the 10-11 second mark, the vehicle collides with or has a very close encounter with the person on the bicycle/scooter. Following the impact, debris (a blue object) is seen on the left side of the road, and the vehicle continues to move forward.
actions: The self-driving vehicle is driving at night under an overpass. It maintains a consistent speed while approaching a person on a bicycle or scooter who is moving slowly in the same lane ahead. Despite the clear and continuous presence of the slower-moving object in its direct path, the vehicle does not appear to initiate sufficient braking or steering adjustments in a timely manner to avoid a collision. This lack of appropriate speed and direction control in response to a visible hazard leads to an impact with the person on the bicycle/scooter. After the collision, the vehicle continues its forward motion, indicating a failure to stop and assess the situation.
key_objects: 1) Center-right to Center: A person on a bicycle or scooter, initially approximately 20-30 meters away, moving slowly in the same lane as the vehicle.
